Ich habe mittlerweile alle Curaprox genutzt, mit Begriffen wie Soft, Super Soft und Ultra soft wird impliziert, dass diese besonders weich sind, wobei erst die "ultra soft" als weich bezeichnet werden kann. Die CS 12460 Velvet mit angeblich 12460 Bosten setzt nochmal einen drauf und ist jetzt wirklich angenehm weich.FÃ¼r Personen mit freien ZahnhÃ¤lsen und empfindlichem Zahnfleisch daher eigentlich top.Auch die Ergonomie passt.Warum also nur 2 Sterne?Nun, Curaprox wirbt, dass die ZahnbÃ¼rste deutlich lÃ¤nger hÃ¤lt wie herkÃ¶mmliche BÃ¼rsten, da sich die Borsten nicht mit Wasser vollsaugen.Leider verkleben die Borsten bei mir aber nach jedem Putzen im mittleren vorderen Bereich.Was nutzen also 12460 Borsten, wenn 1000-2000 davon verkleben und ein "Klumpen" sind?Genau, gar nichts.Ich kenne das Problem schon von der 5460, nach jedem Putzen versuche ich den Klumpen mit einem spitzen Gegenstand zu lÃ¶sen, dabei verliert die BÃ¼rste dann aber auch einige Borsten.Am Ende hÃ¤lt die BÃ¼rste dadurch dann auch nicht lÃ¤nger, da logischerweise irgendwann ein "Loch" entsteht...Wegen offenen ZahnhÃ¤lsen muss ich sanfte Zahnpasta nutzen, ich nutze die handelsÃ¼bliche "Sensodyne multicare".Mein Vater nutzt die selbe BÃ¼rste mit einer anderen (grÃ¶beren) Zahnpasta und hier passiert nichts.Kann also durchaus mit der  Zahnpasta-Kombi zusammen hÃ¤ngen.Doch was bringt eine weiche ZahnbÃ¼rste, wenn man dafÃ¼r stattdessen grobe Zahnpasta nutzen muss?

Just making sure that others are aware that the ITEM COLOR IS RANDOM. The product page only subtly mentions this in one place, so I missed it. I thought I was going to get the Green/Grey (which honestly was half the reason I bought it) because the specs section says Green, but instead I got Baby Blue/pink. Kinda bummed, but I guess I should have read the whole product summary more closely.

I have been using an electric toothbrush for 10 years. I have recently been concerned that it has been causing my gums to recede. My mom's dentist told her about Curaprox toothbrushes, so I thought I would give them a try. I bought the 5460 one (that I haven't yet tried) and this 12460 (that I have tried).I *do* believe that the denseness of the bristles helps clean your teeth better, and initially I was very happy.But I don't know if it's the toothbrush, or if I pressed too hard, but some bristles pop out they extend past the top of the toothbrush â€”Â and these stray bristles make it seem like you have plastic bristles caught on your tongue, in your mouth, etc.. This started happening after 6-7 brushes.The thought of accidentally ingesting these plastic bristles is incredibly stressful. It is like the complete opposite of what I am trying to do. As a result of this, I have decided to buy boar-hair bristle toothbrushes. Although I am usually vegan, I am fed up with plastic. I am returning this.

I wanted a battery powered toothbrush. No big behemoth that oscillated at a gillion times a second and hand all kinds of bells and whistles. Just a toothbrush that would vibrate and be easy on the gums. The description states :  Power Source  Battery Powered.  I figured it must have a aaa battery in the handle and thought it was a good price so I ordered it. Voila !!!  It doesn't take a battery!  It isn't battery powered! Furious.I guess the lesson learned is to contact the seller BEFORE ordering ANYTHING on Amazon. This isn't the first time this has happened. Also tired of getting items that don't work as described (blacklight to detect cat urine that doesn't detect a thing). Waste of time and money to have to travel to a drop off location.

I use curaprox 5460 ultra soft for many years and I'm a big fan.  I bought this one because I only wanted one unit instead of three or more, as I buy the other one.  I was totally disappointed.  It spoiled in a month, the quality is very bad.
